## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 656, 92]]<|/det|>
The random variable \(X\) takes the values \(-2, 2\) and 3. It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 100, 584, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{P}(X = x) = k(x^{2} - 1),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 293, 144]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 158, 146, 176]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 156, 917, 175]]<|/det|>
Draw up the probability distribution table for \(X\), giving the probabilities as numerical fractions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 173, 920, 191]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 504, 193, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 504, 343, 523]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{E}(X)\) and \(\mathrm{Var}(X)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 507, 920, 526]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 742, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that it rains on exactly one of the 4 days of the event.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
A fair 5-sided spinner has sides labelled 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. The spinner is spun repeatedly until a 2 is obtained on the side on which the spinner lands. The random variable \(X\) denotes the number of spins required.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 135, 280, 153]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{P}(X = 4)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 310, 146, 327]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 310, 280, 327]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{P}(X < 6)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 310, 920, 327]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 580, 920, 630]]<|/det|>
Two fair 5-sided spinners, each with sides labelled 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, are spun at the same time. If the numbers obtained are equal, the score is 0. Otherwise, the score is the higher number minus the lower number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 643, 146, 660]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 643, 860, 660]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the score is greater than 0 given that the score is not equal to 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 643, 920, 660]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
